title: Being a victim of rape costs an average of $3,500 in medical bills, study finds
description: The bills can discourage rape reporting and compound victims' trauma.

title: Russian official says civilian satellites may be “legitimate” military target
description: Russia wasn't happy about Starlink providing broadband in Ukraine after invasion.

title: Fire ant rafts form because of the Cheerios effect, study concludes
description: Fire ants will change shape of the raft to reduce drag and adapt to fluid flows.

title: GeForce GPUs are 80% of EVGA’s revenue—but it’s cutting ties with Nvidia anyway
description: EVGA will continue selling current-gen GeForce cards until it runs out of stock.

title: Artists begin selling AI-generated artwork on stock photography websites
description: Using software that creates art on demand, some artists attempt to cash in on AI-generated content.

title: Sony: PSVR2 is “truly next-generation,” so it can’t play PSVR1 games
description: No details on why PSVR2 enhancements mean it can't run less-advanced games.

title: Musk filing claims “conspiracy among Twitter executives” to deceive public
description: Musk countersuit claims "numerous independently sufficient reasons" to break deal.

title: Lots of strange things about Saturn can be explained by a destroyed moon
description: Simulations appear to tie up lots of loose ends.

title: Beloved browser extension acquired by non-beloved antivirus firm
description: You can see why some don't want Avast having access to every site they visit.

title: The end of Ethereum mining could be a bonanza for GPU shoppers
description: Graphics card prices have been dropping all year—and could go even lower.

title: Twitter pranksters derail GPT-3 bot with newly discovered “prompt injection” hack
description: By telling AI bot to ignore its previous instructions, vulnerabilities emerge.

title: Uber was breached to its core, purportedly by an 18-year-old. Here’s what’s known
description: “I announce I am a hacker and Uber has suffered a data breach,” intruder says on Slack.

title: Chrome for Android gets fingerprint-protected Incognito tabs
description: It's buried behind the flag menu for now, but you can enable it on the stable channel.

title: Facebook reverses permanent ban on Holocaust movie after outcry
description: Roy Scheider's final movie is now back on Facebook.

title: Record monsoon flooding in Pakistan due to a confluence of factors
description: Climate’s role is tough to quantify this time, though.

title: The new “Intel Processor” will replace Pentium and Celeron CPU branding in 2023
description: Laptop CPUs will switch first; no word on whether desktop CPUs will follow.

title: How global warming and La Niña fueled a summer of climate extremes
description: Summer saw heat waves, droughts, and floods—sometimes one on top of the other.

title: In a bid to expand its Moon business, Intuitive Machines will go public
description: "This really gives the financial resources to take the next steps."

title: Trojanized versions of PuTTY utility being used to spread backdoor
description: Threat actor has connections to hackers backed by North Korean government.
